status.description: Docker Enterprise Edition (EE) 2.0 is the only enterprise-ready container platform that enables IT leaders to choose how to cost-effectively build and manage their entire application portfolio at their own pace, without fear of architecture and infrastructure lock-in. Docker’s container platform enables organizations to accelerate digital and multi-cloud initiatives by automating the delivery of legacy and modern applications using an agile operating model with integrated security. Because Docker EE includes services, support and training, organizations have a complete containerization strategy for supporting an ever-changing business environment.

action_list.description: System action for creating an application

attrs.script:
sudo yum install -y yum-utils
echo "https://storebits.docker.com/ee/linux/@@{DOCKER_KEY}@@/centos/" | sudo tee /etc/yum/vars/dockerurl
sudo curl -k -LO https://storebits.docker.com/ee/linux/@@{DOCKER_KEY}@@/centos/docker-ee.repo
sudo yum-config-manager --add-repo docker-ee.repo
sudo yum-config-manager --disable docker-ee-*
sudo yum-config-manager --enable @@{DOCKER_VERSION}@@
echo "sslverify=false" | sudo tee -a /etc/yum.conf
sudo yum makecache fast
sudo yum -y install docker-ee
sudo usermod -aG docker centos

sudo pvcreate /dev/sdb /dev/sdc
sudo vgcreate docker /dev/sdb /dev/sdc

sudo lvcreate --wipesignatures y -n thinpool docker -l 95%VG -i2
sudo lvcreate --wipesignatures y -n thinpoolmeta docker -l 1%VG -i2
sudo lvconvert -y --zero n -c 512K --thinpool docker/thinpool --poolmetadata docker/thinpoolmeta

sudo tee /etc/lvm/profile/docker-thinpool.profile <<EOF
activation {
  thin_pool_autoextend_threshold=80
  thin_pool_autoextend_percent=20
}
EOF

sudo lvchange --metadataprofile docker-thinpool docker/thinpool
sudo lvs -o+seg_monitor

sudo mkdir /etc/docker
sudo tee /etc/docker/daemon.json <<EOF
{
  "storage-driver": "devicemapper",
  "storage-opts": [
  	"dm.thinpooldev=/dev/mapper/docker-thinpool",
    "dm.use_deferred_removal=true",
    "dm.use_deferred_deletion=true"
  ]
}
EOF

sudo mkdir /etc/systemd/system/docker.service.d
echo "[Service]" | sudo tee /etc/systemd/system/docker.service.d/docker.conf

sudo systemctl daemon-reload

sudo systemctl start docker
sudo systemctl enable docker
@@{master.worker_token}@@

action_list.name: action_create

action_list.description: System action for deleting an application. Deletes created VMs as well
action_list.name: action_delete

action_list.description: System action for starting an application
action_list.name: action_start

action_list.description: System action for stopping an application
action_list.name: action_stop

action_list.description: System action for restarting an application
action_list.name: action_restart

action_list.description: System action for deleting an application. Does not delete created VMs
action_list.name: action_soft_delete

action_list.description: System action for creating an application

attrs.script:
sudo yum install -y yum-utils
echo "https://storebits.docker.com/ee/linux/@@{DOCKER_KEY}@@/centos/" | sudo tee /etc/yum/vars/dockerurl
sudo curl -k -LO https://storebits.docker.com/ee/linux/@@{DOCKER_KEY}@@/centos/docker-ee.repo
sudo yum-config-manager --add-repo docker-ee.repo
sudo yum-config-manager --disable docker-ee-*
sudo yum-config-manager --enable @@{DOCKER_VERSION}@@
echo "sslverify=false" | sudo tee -a /etc/yum.conf
sudo yum makecache fast
sudo yum -y install docker-ee
sudo usermod -aG docker centos

sudo pvcreate /dev/sdb /dev/sdc
sudo vgcreate docker /dev/sdb /dev/sdc

sudo lvcreate --wipesignatures y -n thinpool docker -l 95%VG -i2
sudo lvcreate --wipesignatures y -n thinpoolmeta docker -l 1%VG -i2
sudo lvconvert -y --zero n -c 512K --thinpool docker/thinpool --poolmetadata docker/thinpoolmeta

sudo tee /etc/lvm/profile/docker-thinpool.profile <<EOF
activation {
  thin_pool_autoextend_threshold=80
  thin_pool_autoextend_percent=20
}
EOF

sudo lvchange --metadataprofile docker-thinpool docker/thinpool
sudo lvs -o+seg_monitor

sudo mkdir /etc/docker
sudo tee /etc/docker/daemon.json <<EOF
{
  "storage-driver": "devicemapper",
  "storage-opts": [
  	"dm.thinpooldev=/dev/mapper/docker-thinpool",
    "dm.use_deferred_removal=true",
    "dm.use_deferred_deletion=true"
  ]
}
EOF

sudo mkdir /etc/systemd/system/docker.service.d
echo "[Service]" | sudo tee /etc/systemd/system/docker.service.d/docker.conf

sudo systemctl daemon-reload

sudo systemctl start docker
sudo systemctl enable docker

# Pull the latest version of UCP
docker image pull docker/ucp:@@{UCP_VERSION}@@

# Write license

echo '@@{UCP_LICENSE}@@' | sudo tee /root/docker.lic

# Install UCP
docker container run --rm -it --name ucp \
  -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock \
  -v /root/docker.lic:/config/docker_subscription.lic \
  docker/ucp:@@{UCP_VERSION}@@ install \
  --host-address @@{address}@@ --admin-password @@{UCP_PASSWORD}@@

# CURRENT_CONFIG_NAME will be the name of the currently active UCP configuration
CURRENT_CONFIG_NAME=$(docker service inspect ucp-agent --format '{{range .Spec.TaskTemplate.ContainerSpec.Configs}}{{if eq "/etc/ucp/ucp.toml" .File.Name}}{{.ConfigName}}{{end}}{{end}}')
# Collect the current config with `docker config inspect`
docker config inspect --format '{{ printf "%s" .Spec.Data }}' $CURRENT_CONFIG_NAME > ucp-config.toml

sed -i -e 's/default_node_orchestrator = "swarm"/default_node_orchestrator = "kubernetes"/' ucp-config.toml



# NEXT_CONFIG_NAME will be the name of the new UCP configuration
NEXT_CONFIG_NAME=${CURRENT_CONFIG_NAME%%-*}-$((${CURRENT_CONFIG_NAME##*-}+1))
# Create the new cluster configuration from the file ucp-config.toml
docker config create $NEXT_CONFIG_NAME  ucp-config.toml
# Use the `docker service update` command to remove the current configuration
# and apply the new configuration to the `ucp-agent` service.
docker service update --config-rm $CURRENT_CONFIG_NAME --config-add source=$NEXT_CONFIG_NAME,target=/etc/ucp/ucp.toml ucp-agent

manager_token=`docker swarm join-token manager | grep token | xargs`

worker_token=`docker swarm join-token worker | grep token | xargs`

echo manager_token=$manager_token
echo worker_token=$worker_token

status.name: Docker Enterprise 2

spec.description: Docker Enterprise Edition (EE) 2.0 is the only enterprise-ready container platform that enables IT leaders to choose how to cost-effectively build and manage their entire application portfolio at their own pace, without fear of architecture and infrastructure lock-in. Docker’s container platform enables organizations to accelerate digital and multi-cloud initiatives by automating the delivery of legacy and modern applications using an agile operating model with integrated security. Because Docker EE includes services, support and training, organizations have a complete containerization strategy for supporting an ever-changing business environment.

action_list.description: System action for creating an application
action_list.name: action_create

attrs.script:
sudo yum install -y yum-utils
echo "https://storebits.docker.com/ee/linux/@@{DOCKER_KEY}@@/centos/" | sudo tee /etc/yum/vars/dockerurl
sudo curl -k -LO https://storebits.docker.com/ee/linux/@@{DOCKER_KEY}@@/centos/docker-ee.repo
sudo yum-config-manager --add-repo docker-ee.repo
sudo yum-config-manager --disable docker-ee-*
sudo yum-config-manager --enable @@{DOCKER_VERSION}@@
echo "sslverify=false" | sudo tee -a /etc/yum.conf
sudo yum makecache fast
sudo yum -y install docker-ee
sudo usermod -aG docker centos

sudo pvcreate /dev/sdb /dev/sdc
sudo vgcreate docker /dev/sdb /dev/sdc

sudo lvcreate --wipesignatures y -n thinpool docker -l 95%VG -i2
sudo lvcreate --wipesignatures y -n thinpoolmeta docker -l 1%VG -i2
sudo lvconvert -y --zero n -c 512K --thinpool docker/thinpool --poolmetadata docker/thinpoolmeta

sudo tee /etc/lvm/profile/docker-thinpool.profile <<EOF
activation {
  thin_pool_autoextend_threshold=80
  thin_pool_autoextend_percent=20
}
EOF

sudo lvchange --metadataprofile docker-thinpool docker/thinpool
sudo lvs -o+seg_monitor

sudo mkdir /etc/docker
sudo tee /etc/docker/daemon.json <<EOF
{
  "storage-driver": "devicemapper",
  "storage-opts": [
  	"dm.thinpooldev=/dev/mapper/docker-thinpool",
    "dm.use_deferred_removal=true",
    "dm.use_deferred_deletion=true"
  ]
}
EOF

sudo mkdir /etc/systemd/system/docker.service.d
echo "[Service]" | sudo tee /etc/systemd/system/docker.service.d/docker.conf

sudo systemctl daemon-reload

sudo systemctl start docker
sudo systemctl enable docker
@@{master.worker_token}@@

sed -i -e 's/default_node_orchestrator = "swarm"/default_node_orchestrator = "kubernetes"/' ucp-config.toml
